arm_group.arm_group_label: Carl Zeiss Meditech VisuMax laser - ReLEx flex
arm_group.description: >30 patients will receive treatment for myopia with a VisuMax femtosecond laser from Carl Zeiss. The laser can cut with two different settings, called ReLEx flex and ReLEx smile. One eye will recieve ReLEx flex, and the other ReLEx smile

arm_group.arm_group_label: Carl Zeiss Meditech VisuMax laser - ReLEx smile
arm_group.description: >30 patients will receive treatment for myopia with a VisuMax femtosecond laser from Carl Zeiss. The laser can cut with two different settings, called ReLEx flex and ReLEx smile. One eye will recieve ReLEx flex, and the other ReLEx smile

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to compare visual acuity, safety, predictability, corneal
      biomechanics, dry eyes, and nerve-morphology after all femtosecond laser refractive
      lenticule extraction. Approximately 30 to 40 patients with moderate to high myopia will
      randomly (after ocular dominance) receive ReLEx flex in one eye, and ReLEx smile in the
      other.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Prospective Study of Femtosecond Laser Intracorneal Lensectomi

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  25 to 45 years,

          -  moderate to high myopia with astigmatism =< 2 D,

          -  otherwise eye healthy,

          -  CDVA of 0.8 or better (Snellen).

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  systemic or ocular disease or previous eye surgery,

          -  thin cornea,

          -  a difference of more than 2 D myopia in the eyes of each subject.

arm_group_label: Carl Zeiss Meditech VisuMax laser - ReLEx flex
Carl Zeiss Meditech VisuMax laser - ReLEx smile
intervention.description: Refractive lenticule extraction (ReLEx) with the Carl Zeiss Meditech VisuMax laser

facility.name: Department of Ophthalmology Aarhus Sygehus - Aarhus University Hospital, Denmark

clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Study of Femtosecond Laser Intracorneal Lensectomi in Treatment of Moderate to High Myopia

other_outcome.description: Corneal hysteresis and corneal resistence factor using the Ocular response analyser, nerve changes using the Cochet-Bonnet Aesthesiometer and confokal mikroscopy, and dry eyes symptoms using Schirmers test, Tear BUT, and Oculus keratograph, along with anterior segment OCT to measure tear meniscus hight.
other_outcome.measure: Corneal biomechanics, corneal nerve changes and dry eye symptoms

overall_official.affiliation: Odense University Hospital, University of Southern Denmark

authority: Denmark: Department of Ophthalmology at both Odense University Hospital and Aarhus University Hospital - Aarhus Sygehus.
Denmark: The Regional Scientific Ethical Committee for Southern Denmark
Denmark: The Central Denmark Region Committees on Health Research Ethics
Denmark: The Danish Data Protection Agency

primary_outcome.description: Using ETDRS charts, both uncorrected and corrected distance visual acuity, along with visual acuity using the FrACT contrast chart

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Optometrists measure refraction at follow-up-examinations, and the refraction 6 monhts after surgery will be compared to the target refraction to calculate refractive predictability

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Treatment
